Try the Developer Framework with Docker Desktop

Learn how to access our introductory Jupyter notebook with the ValidMind Docker image.

Prerequisites

You must have Docker Desktop installed on your machine.

Steps

  1. From the command line, pull the latest ValidMind Docker image:

    docker pull validmind/validmind-jupyter-demo:latest

  2. Run the ValidMind Docker image:

    docker run -it -p 8888:8888 validmind/validmind-jupyter-demo

    After the command completes, you should see a message that Jupyter Server is running similar to this:

    [I 2023-05-18 21:53:06.030 ServerApp] Serving notebooks from local directory: /app
    1 active kernel
    Jupyter Server 2.5.0 is running at:
    http://032c824982aa:8888/lab?token=89e415261acba66a0f897c0d06ffdacfff9340553e65a626
        http://127.0.0.1:8888/lab?token=89e415261acba66a0f897c0d06ffdacfff9340553e65a626

  3. Copy the browser URL that starts with http://127.0.0.1:8888 from the message and paste it into a new browser tab.

    After JupyterLab opens in your browser, you should see a link for our Quickstart_Customer Churn_full_suite.ipynb notebook.

  4. Double click the notebook to open it:

Whatâ€™s Next

Continue with Explore ValidMind in the Quickstart to learn how you can use the sample notebook.
